description: Borrowed from Italian intaglio, from intagliare (“to engrave”).

nouns.description: intaglio (countable and uncountable, plural intagli or intaglios or intaglioes or intaglii)

entries.meaning: A design or piece of art which is engraved or etched into something.
examples: On a wooden pub sign daringly taken, one daylight raid, by a drunken Bartley Gobbitch, across which still survives in intaglio the legend SNIPE AND SHAFT, Teddy Bloat is mincing bananas with a great isosceles knife.

entries.meaning: (printing) Any printing method in which the ink is laid upon the sunken parts of the printing form.

verbs.description: intaglio (third-person singular simple present intaglios, present participle intaglioing, simple past and past participle intaglioed)

entries.meaning: To engrave or etch using intaglio.
